comments:
This is related to bug id 122095. I am copying the text from there. Jun is aware of this bug. He asked me to create this one.

It works in my build (2005-12-27). My enviorment is:
Firefox 1.5, Eclipse 3.0.1, Windows XP.

As the user define the format of drill through to "PDF", the hyperlink will
popup a AcrobatReader and open the PDF file in the reader. When I click the
hyperlink, it works but progress bar in the header of HTML viewer is not
stopped.Althrough you can continue to open next link.

When the user changes the drillthroug target to "_Blank" instead of "_Self",
the Eclipse throws out an exception:
org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2717)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2616)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2587)
        at org.eclipse.swt.browser.Browser.<init>(Browser.java:146)
        at
org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.internal.ui.editors.preview.PreviewEditor$4.run(PreviewEditor.java:345)
(This is only happens in Eclipse 3.0.1)

re-assign to viewer.
swt browser handles hyperlink click events.
Change the prompt text to "Choose projects to launch from the list".
Please ignore the last comment. made by mistake.
*** Bug 122870 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
